instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - LCD Not turning lighting UP
threads.message:
[LIST=1]
[*]I have strongly believed it's a problem with lvds cable, I have changed the cable ..oooopzzz... NO luck.
[*]Checked with a good known LCD - Yes its working.
[*]What would be wrong with this LCD ?  
[/LIST]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - LCD Not turning lighting UP
threads.message:
Compatible LCD for sure?
Missing backlight, or image too?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - LCD Not turning lighting UP
threads.message:
Is there a way I can make sure of the compatibility It was <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013? The replacement tried was from 2014. The only possibility is whether the display is a 2015 model or not... I don't have a 2015 model laptop for testing.

No image , No backlight

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - LCD Not turning lighting UP
threads.message:
You didn't say what board model have on the desk.
3536 is 2013 made; 3476 is from 2014.
4924 is from 2015; last good laptop made by Apple.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - LCD Not turning lighting UP
threads.message: Both the boards I have tried are  3476, Still not sure the display belongs to which model.. How can we identify it from a display?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - LCD Not turning lighting UP
threads.message:
If you get image with another LCD, then the board is OK.

The other LCD is not compatible, or have an internal problem.
Keep it in stock to check with different board model, just in case.
